Name: Vienna
Description: Vienna is the capital and largest city of Austria, known for its imperial palaces, classical music heritage, and vibrant cultural scene.

Name: Lower Austria
Description: Lower Austria is the largest state by area and surrounds Vienna. It is known for its vineyards, rural landscapes, and historical sites.

Name: Upper Austria
Description: Upper Austria is known for its beautiful lakes and mountains, as well as its industrial and economic importance in Austria.

Name: Styria
Description: Styria is famous for its natural beauty, wine production, and historic towns. It is often called the green heart of Austria.

Name: Tyrol
Description: Tyrol is renowned for its stunning alpine scenery and as a major destination for skiing and outdoor sports.

Name: Carinthia
Description: Carinthia is known for its lakes, mountains, and Mediterranean climate, making it a popular holiday destination.

Name: Salzburg
Description: Salzburg is famous for its baroque architecture, alpine surroundings, and as the birthplace of composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.

Name: Vorarlberg
Description: Vorarlberg is the westernmost state of Austria, known for its modern architecture and proximity to Switzerland and Germany.

Name: Burgenland
Description: Burgenland is known for its wine production, fertile plains, and historical castles.
